content.description:
Tricky start up into wide groove (a #5 C4 protects these moves).  Go up offwidth which narrows to hands up over a ledge.  Continue up cracks into a chimney on the right (you could also face climb left on unprotected easy climbing), ending on top of a block. The route joins Beyond and Back here to the right and proceeds to the top up one of the cracks, which turns into a nice hand crack.

Gear belay, sling a large block, or traverse right up top to hit chains.

Descent: Walk up and over (south) to rap Roadkill's chains with a 70m.
content.protection: Single rack of cams to #4, stoppers, slings.  You will also want a #5 C4 size cam for the start, and the #4 for the offwidth.
content.location: Starts in groove/offwidth in front of tree, 20ft left of Beyond and Back.

content.description: This route is located about 20ft right of Hesitation Blues on the east facing side of the rock. It follows a seam with good finger pockets for the first half and is slaby sport for the second half.
content.protection: Mostly small gear for the trad portion, QD's for the rest.

content.description: Go to the east side of Rabbit Rock and hike down to the large boulder at the base of the wall.  There is a significant drop off at the end of the boulder.  This is where Hesitation Blues begins.  Climb the crack with large face holds to the top of the formation.
content.protection: This route eats cams, especially in the fingers to hands sizes.  A great lead for a beginning climber. Gear to 3".

content.description: Quality but short finger tips crack. If it were longer,it would likely be a classic.
content.protection: Black aliens, .01 camalots, 00 tcu's and small wireds
content.location: Just follow the east face north from Roadkill for about 100 ft.

content.description: High-angle slab with a delicate "smear-mantle".  crux about 3/4 the way up. Well bolted, sustained and challenging climbing with a crux crescendo and denouement.
content.protection: Bolts (~8) plus supplemental gear to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: About 100 yards south of "Hesitation Blues" on the east side of Rabbit Rock.

content.description:
Fun route with a variety of jams, stems and chimney techniques required.  The first part of the route is sort of a half pipe.  Then its fingers and hands.  After about 70 feet it merges with the wide 8 that is to its left , but it is a straight up line.  Its a bit dirty but still worthwhile.

I highly doubt this was an FA although it did not appear to have ever been cleaned up.  If anyone knows the correct name and FA's please update.
content.protection: Standard rack.  A #3 camalot is useful.
content.location:
About 80 feet right of Hesitation Blues, 20 feet right of the wide 8.  It is not in the current guide book but it shares the finish with the wide 8 that is in the current book.

Rap:  scramble north west to chains and rap about 30 feet.  Then, scramble north to slings and tat.  Rap 30 feet to the ground.
